description.narrative: Output 5.8 Evaluation: Staff and partners are provided guidance tools and resources to effectively evaluate programmes, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Evaluation, Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Reducing Child Poverty, Research, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 5 - Programme Effectiveness: Country programmes are efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards for achieving results for children

participating-org.narrative: DEPARTMENT OF GENDER AND SOCIAL SER GARISSA

sector.narrative: Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Strengthening data and national information systems, including routine systems, nutrition surveys and assessments (early childhood nutrition)

Technical assistance - Child poverty, Public Finance and Local Governance

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 5.8 Evaluation: Staff and partners are provided guidance tools and resources to effectively evaluate programmes

description.narrative: The annual targets on completing evaluation and budget utilization for evaluation were met. Of the four evaluations, the Mid-Term Evaluation of the Maternal Child Nutrition Program II (MCNP II) is completed and the other are scheduled to be completed by March 2022. On National Evaluation Capacity Development (NECD), the office continued supporting Monitoring and Evaluation Directorate (MED) in rolling out the Kenya Evaluation Guideline through Training of Trainers (ToT) approach covering key national and county level government agencies. The institutionalization support of Evaluation Society of Kenya (ESK) through the Small-Scale Funding Agreement (SSFA) was implemented during the year. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:04/01/2022
